rowHeaders: Mentorship provided by research  team leader (PI)
Collegiality and collaborative  nature of the research team  members,
Degree of alignment between the  potential thesis research projects  and my research interests,
Degree of alignment between  average time to degree for trainees in research and my own  expectations for time to degree,
The type of funding available  (e.g., RA, TA, PA),
The length of funding available  (1 yr., 2 yrs., etc.),
The degree of flexibility in how  many and which hours of the day  I am expected to be in lab each week
Ability to be myself in this research group without fear  of alienation or negative repercussions,
The size of the research group and  the infrastructure for communication in the group
Access to resources beyond the  group to support my success (e.g., equipment, professional  development opportunities, community),
